media_work.title: Gladiator
media_work.creator: Ridley Scott
anachronisms: Marcus Aurelius intended to restore the Republic
Commodus dies in the arena shortly after taking power
Lucilla survives the reign of Commodus

historical_figures.name: Maximus Decimus Meridius
historical_figures.title: General / Gladiator
historical_figures.role_description: Composite protagonist inspired by Avidius Cassius, Narcissus, and Tiberius Claudius Pompeianus.

portrayals.role_description: A weary, noble emperor who seeks to return power to the Senate and is murdered for his idealism.
portrayals.conflict_notes: Portrayal as a Republican restorationist and his murder by Commodus are significant historical deviations.

portrayals.role_description: A patricidal, power-hungry youth driven by a psychological need for his father's approval.
portrayals.conflict_notes: Characterization as a patricide and his arena-death in 180 CE conflict with historical 192 CE assassination in a bath.

portrayals.role_description: A cautious survivor and mother who quietly aids the conspiracy against her brother to save her son.
portrayals.conflict_notes: Survival of the film's events contradicts her historical execution in 182 CE.

media_work.title: The Fall of the Roman Empire
media_work.creator: Anthony Mann

portrayals.role_description: An aging idealist who envisions a universal citizenship for all people in the Empire.
portrayals.conflict_notes: Poisoned by plotters; intends to disinherit Commodus in favor of Livius.

portrayals.role_description: A dissolute leader revealed to be the biological son of a gladiator rather than the Emperor.
portrayals.conflict_notes: Illegitimacy plotline based on ancient slanders used as a narrative device.

portrayals.role_description: Internal self-reflection of a man struggling to perform his imperial duty through Stoic discipline.
portrayals.conflict_notes: Primary source; provides the psychological baseline for all subsequent fictional versions.

media_work.title: Total War: ROME II - Empire Divided
media_work.creator: Creative Assembly

portrayals.role_description: A powerful general who can emerge as a political rival and usurper through systemic game mechanics.
portrayals.conflict_notes: Represented through procedural loyalty and civil war mechanics rather than scripted narrative.
